an6.87:1.1: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:1.3: They murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re witless, dull, and stupid.
an6.87:1.4: Someone with these six qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:2.1: Someone with six qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an6.87:2.3: They don’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They don’t maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They don’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re wise, bright, and clever.
an6.87:2.4: Someone with these six qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
